section.title: High Cohesion
section.para: Cohesion is the degree to which a class has a single, focused purpose.
We can achieve high cohesion by adhering to the following rules:

listitem.para: If not all clients of an interface use all methods of an interface, we should split the interface up.

section.title: Trade-off
section.para: A class with high cohesion is typically less complex than a class with low cohesion.
